It covers your mandatory bases (including your backlog), adds Artificial Intelligence, and introduces Information Security. This is a great way to explore a hot area that connects with both AI and web development – and it’ll look great on your resume.

course_rationale.BCSE205L: Retaking this is a must-do – it’s your key to unlocking future electives.
course_rationale.BCSE301L: Crucial for any software engineering path.
course_rationale.BCSE301P: Real-world lab work makes your skillset practical.
course_rationale.BCSE302L: Databases are essential for web and AI work.
course_rationale.BCSE302P: Get comfortable with the tools used in industry.
course_rationale.BCSE306L: This is your entry into AI – the field you’re excited about.
course_rationale.BCSE317L: Information Security is a core skill for both web and AI, and cyber skills are in demand everywhere. This elective stretches you, but you’ll be glad you took it when you interview for any tech role.

recommendations.suitability: Pick this if you’re ready for a bigger challenge, want to build a standout skillset, and are comfortable with a slightly heavier (but still manageable) workload.
